form.official-title: To end the use of body-gripping traps in the National Wildlife Refuge System.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Refuge from Cruel Trapping Act.

section.header: Possession or use of body-gripping trap prohibited
section.text: The National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966 (16 U.S.C. 668dd et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Possession or use of body-gripping trap prohibited

subsection.text: As used in this section, the term body-gripping trap—

paragraph.text: means any device that is intended to kill or capture wildlife by physically restraining any part of the animal;
includes any steel-jaw, padded, or other modified leghold trap, kill-type trap, snare trap, or any modified version of any such trap; and
does not include any cage or box trap or suitcase-type live beaver trap.

subsection.text: No person may possess or use a body-gripping trap in the System.
Notwithstanding section 4(f), a person who possesses or uses a body-gripping trap in the System shall be subject to—

paragraph.text: in the case of a first offense, a civil fine of not more than $500 imposed by the Secretary for each body-gripping trap possessed or used; and
in the case of a subsequent offense—

subparagraph.text: a civil fine of not more than $1,000 imposed by the Secretary for each body-gripping trap possessed or used;
imprisonment for not more than 180 days; or
both a civil fine and imprisonment in accordance with subparagraphs (A) and (B).

subsection.text: Any body-gripping trap that is possessed or used in violation of this section, and any wildlife captured by the use of the trap, including the pelt or raw fur, shall be subject to forfeiture to the United States in accordance with the provisions of chapter 46 of title 18, United States Code, relating to civil forfeitures.

subsection.header: Payment of court costs and other associated expenses
subsection.text: A person found to be in violation of subsection (b) shall pay all court costs associated with the violation.
Not later than 120 days after the date of enactment of this section, the Secretary shall issue any regulations necessary to carry out this section.
